summary.blockquote: NOTENote: Instead of using this deprecated property, compare to "stopped".

remarks.para: The read-only stopped property on the interface indicates whether or not the transceiver's associated sender and receiver have both been stopped.
The transceiver is stopped if the method has been called or if a change to either the local or the remote description has caused the transceiver to be stopped for some reason.

-WebRTC API
-Introduction to the Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP)

RTCRtpTransceiverStopped.value:
A Boolean value which is true if the transceiver's
will no longer send data, and its
will no longer receive data. If
either or both are still at work, the result is false.
